  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xebisco.yield.swingimpl.SwingPlatform

    AudioManager, Disposable, FontLoader, InputManager, PlatformGraphics, TextureManager, ViewportZoomScale, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseWheelListener, java.util.EventListener

extends java.lang.Object
implements PlatformGraphics, FontLoader, TextureManager, InputManager, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseWheelListener, AudioManager, ViewportZoomScale

      • setPixels

        public void setPixels​(java.lang.Object imageRef,
                      int[] pixels)
        Description copied from interface: TextureManager
        The function sets an array of pixels in a given image reference.
        Specified by:
        setPixels in interface TextureManager
        Parameters:
        imageRef - The imageRef parameter is an object reference that represents the image to which the pixels will be set.
        pixels - The "pixels" parameter is an array of integers that represents the color values of each pixel in an image. Each integer in the array represents a single pixel and contains information about the color of that pixel.

      • getPixel

        public int[] getPixel​(java.lang.Object imageRef,
                      int x,
                      int y)
        Description copied from interface: TextureManager
        The function returns an array of integers representing the pixel values at a specified (x,y) coordinate of an image.
        Specified by:
        getPixel in interface TextureManager
        Parameters:
        imageRef - The image reference is an object that represents the image from which we want to retrieve the pixel value. It could be an instance of a class that represents an image file format, such as BufferedImage in Java or PIL.Image in Python.
        x - The x-coordinate of the pixel you want to retrieve from the image. This represents the horizontal position of the pixel in the image.
        y - The y-coordinate of the pixel you want to retrieve from the image. This represents the vertical position of the pixel in the image.
        Returns:
        An array of integers representing the color values of the pixel at the specified coordinates (x,y) in the image referenced by the object imageRef.

      • cropTexture

        public Texture cropTexture​(java.lang.Object imageRef,
                           int x,
                           int y,
                           int w,
                           int h)
        Description copied from interface: TextureManager
        This function crops a texture from an image reference at the specified x, y coordinates with the specified width and height.
        Specified by:
        cropTexture in interface TextureManager
        Parameters:
        imageRef - The image reference or object that contains the texture to be cropped.
        x - The x-coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangular area to be cropped from the texture.
        y - The parameter "y" in the method "cropTexture" represents the vertical starting position of the area to be cropped from the texture. It is the distance in pixels from the top edge of the texture to the top edge of the cropped area.
        w - w stands for the width of the cropped texture. It determines how many pixels wide the cropped texture will be.
        h - h stands for height. It is the height of the rectangular area that needs to be cropped from the texture.
        Returns:
        The method is returning a cropped texture of the input imageRef object, with the specified dimensions (x, y, w, h) for the cropped area. The returned value is of type Texture.

      • scaledTexture

        public Texture scaledTexture​(java.lang.Object imageRef,
                             int w,
                             int h)
        Description copied from interface: TextureManager
        The function scales an image to a specified width and height and returns a texture object.
        Specified by:
        scaledTexture in interface TextureManager
        Parameters:
        imageRef - The image reference or object that needs to be scaled. It could be an image file or an object representing an image in memory.
        w - The parameter "w" in the method signature represents the desired width of the scaled texture. It is an integer value that specifies the width in pixels.
        h - The parameter "h" in the method signature "Texture scaledTexture(Object imageRef, int w, int h)" represents the desired height of the scaled texture. The method takes an image reference as input and returns a new texture object that is scaled to the specified width and height.
        Returns:
        The method `scaledTexture` is returning a `Texture` object.

      • loadAudio

        public java.lang.Object loadAudio​(AudioPlayer audioPlayer)
        Description copied from interface: AudioManager
        This function loads an audio file.
        Specified by:
        loadAudio in interface AudioManager
        Parameters:
        audioPlayer - The "audio" parameter in the "loadAudio" method is an object of the "AudioPlayer" class. This object contains an audio file that needs to be loaded into the program. The "loadAudio" method is responsible for loading the audio file into the program and returning its clip reference.
        Returns:
        The audio clip reference.

      • unloadAudio

        public void unloadAudio​(AudioPlayer audioPlayer)
        Description copied from interface: AudioManager
        The function unloads an audio clip from an audio player.
        Specified by:
        unloadAudio in interface AudioManager
        Parameters:
        audioPlayer - The "audio" parameter is an object of type "AudioPlayer" that contains an audio file that has been loaded into memory. The "unloadAudio" function is used to free up the memory used by the audio file.

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition​(AudioPlayer audioPlayer,
                        double position)
        Description copied from interface: AudioManager
        The function sets the position of an audio player.
        Specified by:
        setPosition in interface AudioManager
        Parameters:
        audioPlayer - The audio player.
        position - The position parameter is a double value that represents the desired position in the audio file being played by the AudioPlayer. It is measured in seconds from the beginning of the audio file. By setting the position parameter, you can move the playback position of the audio file to a specific point in time.

      • setGain

        Description copied from interface: AudioManager
        The function sets the gain of an audio player.
        Specified by:
        setGain in interface AudioManager
        Parameters:
        audioPlayer - The audioPlayer parameter is an object of the AudioPlayer class. It represents the audio player that you want to set the gain for.
        gain - The gain parameter in the setGain() function is a double value that represents the amount of amplification to be applied to the audio signal.
